Outline: The Disaster Management Division (DMD) of India, reports that at least 24 people have lost their lives after floods in the state of Andhra Pradesh that began from 18-19 November 2021. DMD said that, as of 21 November, 24 people had lost their lives and 17 were missing.
More Information of Incident: ['2021/11/18-19', 'India', 'Flood', 'The Disaster Management Division (DMD) of India, reports that at least 24 people have lost their lives after floods in the state of Andhra Pradesh that began from 18-19 November 2021. DMD said that, as of 21 November, 24 people had lost their lives and 17 were missing. ']

Outline: Tropical Cyclone FANI made landfall in Odisha State, India on the morning of 3 May 2019, with maximum sustained winds up to 240 km/h. Over 1 million people have been evacuated from coastal communities in Odisha and Andhra Pradesh and 4,852 shelters have been set up.
More Information of Incident: ['2019/05/03', 'India', 'Tropical Cyclone', 'Tropical Cyclone FANI made landfall in Odisha State, India on the morning of 3 May 2019, with maximum sustained winds up to 240 km/h. Over 1 million people have been evacuated from coastal communities in Odisha and Andhra Pradesh and 4,852 shelters have been set up.']

Outline: Heat wave claims over 100 lives in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, India.
More Information of Incident: ['2016/04', 'India', 'Heat Wave', 'Heat wave claims over 100 lives in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, India.']

Outline: As of 23 May, more than 350 people are reported to have died in a heat wave, where temperatures have reached 48C. The worst affected states are Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

Outline: On 12 October 2014, Cyclone Hudhud made landfall in India's state of Andhra Pradesh. At least six people have been killed and 150,000 people have been evacuated.
More Information of Incident: ['2014/10/12', 'India', 'Tropical Cyclone', "On 12 October 2014, Cyclone Hudhud made landfall in India's state of Andhra Pradesh. At least six people have been killed and 150,000 people have been evacuated. "]

Outline: Cyclone Phailin made landfall on the eastern coast of India at around 9pm (local time) on 12 October 2013. Nearly 600,000 people in Odisha and Andhra Prahesh State have been evacuated.
More Information of Incident: ['2013/10/12', 'India', 'Tropical Cyclone', 'Cyclone Phailin made landfall on the eastern coast of India at around 9pm (local time) on 12 October 2013. Nearly 600,000 people in Odisha and Andhra Prahesh State have been evacuated.']

Outline: At least 22 people have been killed by heavy rains in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, say state media, days after Cyclone Nilam hit.
More Information of Incident: ['2012/11/04', 'India', 'Flood', 'At least 22 people have been killed by heavy rains in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, say state media, days after Cyclone Nilam hit.']

Outline: Cyclone Laila hit the coast of southern India's Andhra Pradesh state on 20 May 2010, leaving 16 people dead and flooded thousands of homes.
More Information of Incident: ['2010/05/20', 'India', 'Tropical Cyclone', "Cyclone Laila hit the coast of southern India's Andhra Pradesh state on 20 May 2010, leaving 16 people dead and flooded thousands of homes."]

Outline: Heavy monsoon rains in southern India have destroyed houses and flooded parts of Andhra Pradesh, killing at least 40 people over the weekend, officials say.

Outline: Lightning strikes and falling trees have killed 20 people in pre-monsoon storms which lashed two Indian states, officials said on Saturday. At least 12 people died in the southern state of Andhra Pradesh and eight others were struck dead by lightning in West Bengal on Friday, they said

Outline: A cyclone tore into India's southeastern coast, killing at least 45 people. The storm triggered heavy rains and flooding, destroying houses in several villages across four coastal districts of Andhra Pradesh state.

Outline: A heatwave has killed at least 178 people in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh and the toll is expected to rise.The temperature in the worst-hit district along the Bay of Bengal coast has hit a high of 48 degrees Celsius (118 degrees Fahrenheit) in recent days compared with an average temperature of 40 to 45 Celsius.

Outline: India is experiencing a severe drought which is rapidly spreading over large areas of southern and western Asian countries. The drought is particularly marked in the area stretching from the worst affected states of Rajasthan and Gujarat down to Andhra Pradesh. More than 90 million people in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh alone are in the grip of the severe drought.
More Information of Incident: ['2000/05', 'India', 'Drought', 'India is experiencing a severe drought which is rapidly spreading over large areas of southern and western Asian countries. The drought is particularly marked in the area stretching from the worst affected states of Rajasthan and Gujarat down to Andhra Pradesh. More than 90 million people in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh alone are in the grip of the severe drought. ']

Outline:
A cyclone centred over the Bay of Bengal, reportedly with wind speeds of up to 200 kms per hour lashed the coastal region of Orissa and Andhra Pradesh early Monday morning (18th October, 1999). 
The rains finally stopped Tuesday.85 people were killed and 250 injured.The Ganjam district is the worst affected. About 300,000 people in 300 villages are homeless.
More Information of Incident:
['1999/10/17', 'India', 'Tropical Cyclone', 'A cyclone centred over the Bay of Bengal, reportedly with wind speeds of up to 200 kms per hour lashed the coastal region of Orissa and Andhra Pradesh early Monday morning (18th October, 1999). 
The rains finally stopped Tuesday.85 people were killed and 250 injured.The Ganjam district is the worst affected. About 300,000 people in 300 villages are homeless.  

', 'According to the media, the death toll rose to 84 on 20 October, with some 500,000 people across 460 coastal villages badly affected. ', '15,000 houses were damaged and 60 villages were severely affected in the districts of Ganjam, Puri, Khurda and Gajapathi. The cyclone damaged electricity transmission towers, also causing the disruption of the water supply system in Orissa. 
', '', 'Unconfirmed reports put the number of people killed at 150 and up to 1,000 injured. 

', 'The damage from the cyclone in terms of loss of property can be estimated at 20 billion rupees (470 million dollars).', '', 'The death toll from a cyclone which ravaged eastern India has risen to 84.A total of 81 people have died in Orissa, with worst-hit Ganjam district alone accounting for 73 fatalities, state officials said.Unconfirmed reports put the number of people killed at 100 and those injured at 500. ', "The damage from the cyclone in terms of loss of property can be estimated at over five billion rupees (117 million dollars).(by president of the state's ruling Congress party)
The power lines have not been restored. Water supply has also badly affected. 
High-speed winds snapped telecommunication, electricity, rail and road networks, flattened an unspecified number of houses and destroyed the coconut, cashewnut and banana plantations of the area. 

", '', 'At least fifty-nine people have died.', 'The cyclone has also ruined crops and paralysed road and rail transport.', '']
